result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Merkel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 43 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is to be determined.
AMENDED 01-13-2016:  Court sets restitution at zero ($0).

Court costs ($278), Extradition Fee ($300) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AMENDED 01-13-2016:  Court amends Extradition Fee to $200.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-actor.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint, their residences or anyone that resides at their residence except with their permission.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
Commencing forthwith.
Last 90 days can be served with Day Reporting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jennifer L Merkel in court with attorney Joy M Nonnweiler.   Pablo Galaviz, Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Restitution hearing. 
State advised court that the victims were notified of today's hearing.
State advised court that the victim, G.M. was notified and wants his restitution set at zero and there is no appearance by the other victim, AAA Insurance, Auto Club Group.
Parties agree to $200.00 in Extradition costs as restitution. 
At the time of sentencing Extradition costs were set at $300.00. State moves to amend to $200.00 in Extradition costs. Court sets Extradition costs at $200.00. 
Amended Judgment to be done amending to $200.00 in Extradition costs and setting restitution at zero.
Copy of letter to AAA Insurance filed by State in regards to restitution and the hearing on 1/13/16.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jennifer L Merkel in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joy M Nonnweiler.   

Defendant pleas Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is Dismissed as a Read-In.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  6.5 Years
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years
Extended Supervision:  4 Years
43 Days Credit
Stayed

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


TERM OF PROBATION:  4  YEAR(S);
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actor 
No Contact with: Victims listed in the Criminal Complaint, their residence or anyone that resides in their residence except with their permission. 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268
RESTITUTION:  $300 (to be paid to the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office - for Extradition from Minnesota ) - restitution to be paid first.
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
To be paid as a condition of probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including work search) - NON-WORKING HOURS
Last 90 days can be served with Day Reporting
Defendant can be transferred to Huber - Forthwith
  
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on September 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jennifer L Merkel in court, in custody, with attorney Joy M Nonnweiler.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments and requests a modification in bail or huber bailee status. State presents arguments and objects to any modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. 
  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on August 27, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
